title: How to Make Goat Cheese Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) as you line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
steps.description: Set the mixer on medium speed and beat until the butter and sugar are creamy.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat each one in for an additional 30 seconds.
Add the vanilla.
Add the ricotta and goat cheeses, mixing until well combined.
Whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt in a separate mixing bowl until the dry ingredients are well combined.
Add 1/3 of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.
Mix them on low speed until the dry ingredients are incorporated into the wet ingredients.
Continue adding the dry ingredients gradually, mixing well between each addition.
Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet using a tablespoon or a cookie scoop.
steps.description: Leave 1” (2-1/2 cm) of space around each cookie so that the cookies have room to spread.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies turn light brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and transfer the cookies to wire racks to cool.
Combine the confectioner’s sugar, vanilla extract and milk in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: You may either combine the mixture with a whisk or use a mixer set to low speed.

steps.headline: Spread the icing on the top of the cooled cookies using either a cheese spreader or a butter knife.
Drizzle candy sprinkles on top of the icing.
Combine the goat cheese, garlic, lemon zest, rosemary, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, and set the mixer to medium speed.

steps.headline: Add the butter and beat until the butter is well combined.
Add 1/3 of the flour to the mix, mixing well at low speed until it’s well combined.
Continue adding the flour in 1/3-batches until you’ve incorporated all of it into the batter.
Fold in the walnuts using a flat plastic spatula.
Sprinkle flour onto a work surface.
steps.description: Dump the dough out onto the work surface.

steps.headline: Divide the dough into two logs.
steps.description: The logs should be about 6” (15 centimeters) long and about 1-1/2” (3 cm) in diameter.

steps.headline: Wrap the logs tightly in plastic wrap, twisting the ends tightly.
steps.description: This will help the logs to set in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Place the logs into the refrigerator and chill them for 2 hours.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can place the logs into the freezer and chill them for about 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the logs from the refrigerator or freezer and unwrap them.
Place the blade of a chef’s knife 1/4” (6 mm) from the end of one log and gently push down to slice off a cookie.
Place the cookie on the baking sheet.
Continue slicing the cookies, making sure to maintain at least a 1/4” (6 mm) thickness for each cookie.
steps.description: Leave 2” (5 cm) of space around each cookie.

steps.headline: Crumble the additional goat cheese over the top of the cookies.
Bake the cookies for 14 to 16 minutes, or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges.
Cool the cookies completely on the baking sheet.
Serve the cookies with a glass of chilled sauvignon blanc.
Finished.

text: Sweet Goat Cheese Cookies Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) as you line a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Combine the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment. Set the mixer on medium speed and beat until the butter and sugar are creamy. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat each one in for an additional 30 seconds.  Add the vanilla.  Add the ricotta and goat cheeses, mixing until well combined.  Whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt in a separate mixing bowl until the dry ingredients are well combined.  Add 1/3 of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.  Mix them on low speed until the dry ingredients are incorporated into the wet ingredients.  Continue adding the dry ingredients gradually, mixing well between each addition.  Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet using a tablespoon or a cookie scoop. Leave 1” (2-1/2 cm) of space around each cookie so that the cookies have room to spread. Bake the cookies for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies turn light brown.  Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on the stovetop for 2 minutes.  Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and transfer the cookies to wire racks to cool.  Combine the confectioner’s sugar, vanilla extract and milk in a mixing bowl. You may either combine the mixture with a whisk or use a mixer set to low speed. Spread the icing on the top of the cooled cookies using either a cheese spreader or a butter knife.  Drizzle candy sprinkles on top of the icing.  Savory Goat Cheese Cookies Combine the goat cheese, garlic, lemon zest, rosemary, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl. Use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, and set the mixer to medium speed. Add the butter and beat until the butter is well combined.  Add 1/3 of the flour to the mix, mixing well at low speed until it’s well combined.  Continue adding the flour in 1/3-batches until you’ve incorporated all of it into the batter.  Fold in the walnuts using a flat plastic spatula.  Sprinkle flour onto a work surface. Dump the dough out onto the work surface. Divide the dough into two logs. The logs should be about 6” (15 centimeters) long and about 1-1/2” (3 cm) in diameter. Wrap the logs tightly in plastic wrap, twisting the ends tightly. This will help the logs to set in the refrigerator. Place the logs into the refrigerator and chill them for 2 hours. Alternatively, you can place the logs into the freezer and chill them for about 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Remove the logs from the refrigerator or freezer and unwrap them.  Place the blade of a chef’s knife 1/4” (6 mm) from the end of one log and gently push down to slice off a cookie.  Place the cookie on the baking sheet.  Continue slicing the cookies, making sure to maintain at least a 1/4” (6 mm) thickness for each cookie. Leave 2” (5 cm) of space around each cookie. Crumble the additional goat cheese over the top of the cookies.  Bake the cookies for 14 to 16 minutes, or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges.  Cool the cookies completely on the baking sheet.  Serve the cookies with a glass of chilled sauvignon blanc.  Finished.
